meanings.definition: Not capable of being decomposed by biological agents.
meanings.sent1: Plastic bags are nonbiodegradable and harm the environment.
meanings.sent2: The nonbiodegradable waste will remain in the landfill for hundreds of years.
meanings.sent3: The nonbiodegradable trash seemed to have a never-ending life of its own.
meanings.sent4: Her nonbiodegradable attitude towards change made it hard for her to adapt.
meanings.sent5: The nonbiodegradable material stood out like a sore thumb in the natural landscape.

meanings.definition: Unable to be broken down into simpler substances by natural processes.
meanings.sent1: The nonbiodegradable chemicals in the water posed a serious threat to aquatic life.
meanings.sent2: It is concerning how many nonbiodegradable products we use in our daily lives.
meanings.sent3: The nonbiodegradable gum stuck to his shoe like a stubborn friend.
meanings.sent4: The nonbiodegradable problem loomed over the city like a dark cloud.
meanings.sent5: The nonbiodegradable truth of the situation hit her like a ton of bricks.
